intro: Pentaschistis effusa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, typically found in rocky or mountainous habitats. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Pentaschistis effusa is generally a short-lived perennial, adapted to grow in poor, well-drained soils.
